title: How to Make Candy Corn on the Cob

steps.headline: Combine the butter and sugar.
steps.description: In a mixing bowl, stir the softened butter and sugar with a wooden until they're combined properly and the mixture is fluffy.

steps.headline: Pour in the milk and vanilla extract into the softened butter mixture.
steps.description: Combine and mix with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are folded in to the mixture.

steps.headline: Combine the flour and salt in a separate bowl and mix with a wooden spoon.
steps.description: Stir until the dry ingredients are mixed properly.

steps.headline: Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients.
steps.description: Mix using your hands. Since the dough will be slightly hard to handle, it is much easier to fold in the ingredients using your hands. Mix until the sugar cookie dough forms.

steps.headline: Let the cookie dough chill.
steps.description: Roll the cookie dough in a ball. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the fridge to chill for about an hour.

steps.headline: Roll out the dough.
steps.description: Remove the cookie dough from the fridge. Take off the plastic wrap and grab a fistful of dough. Roll it out in a ball and form it into a tube shape. Set aside and repeat until there is no more dough.

steps.headline: Poke the candy corn into the tube-shaped pieces, with the smaller end going in first.
steps.description: Make rows with the candy corn until it resembles a corn on the cob. Repeat with the rest of the dough pieces.

steps.headline: Poke a popsicle stick in the middle of the 'cob'.
steps.description: To make the cob easier to handle, poke a large popsicle stick in the middle of each cob.

steps.headline: Serve them up.
steps.description: Place the cobs on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!

text: Combine the butter and sugar. In a mixing bowl, stir the softened butter and sugar with a wooden until they're combined properly and the mixture is fluffy. Pour in the milk and vanilla extract into the softened butter mixture. Combine and mix with a wooden spoon until the ingredients are folded in to the mixture. Combine the flour and salt in a separate bowl and mix with a wooden spoon. Stir until the dry ingredients are mixed properly. Pour the dry ingredients into the wet ingredients. Mix using your hands. Since the dough will be slightly hard to handle, it is much easier to fold in the ingredients using your hands. Mix until the sugar cookie dough forms. Let the cookie dough chill. Roll the cookie dough in a ball. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the fridge to chill for about an hour. Roll out the dough. Remove the cookie dough from the fridge. Take off the plastic wrap and grab a fistful of dough. Roll it out in a ball and form it into a tube shape. Set aside and repeat until there is no more dough. Poke the candy corn into the tube-shaped pieces, with the smaller end going in first. Make rows with the candy corn until it resembles a corn on the cob. Repeat with the rest of the dough pieces. Poke a popsicle stick in the middle of the 'cob'. To make the cob easier to handle, poke a large popsicle stick in the middle of each cob. Serve them up. Place the cobs on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!
